reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful, old colonial style property. Marble and chandeliers are stunning and the bar area surprisingly cosy. Services is impeccable in the main, although the pool chaps needed to to shape a bit as there were no towels and distinct lack of attention.
reviews.title: Lived up to its luxury name, shame the walls are not thicker !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great, ideal for a stroll into town where there are plenty of good restaurants.
reviews.title: ALWAYS A 5 STAR EXPERIENCE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sadly the single thing that let the Ritz down for us was the paper thin walls! We could hear the regular lift 'ding' AND absolutely everything and I mean everything the guy in the room next door was doing, from his snoring, his alarm, phone calls, ( he was late) and his ablutions ! ( which made him later) Such a shame.
reviews.title: Can't go wrong here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Ritz Carlton Sarasota at least 15 times since it opened....always for pleasure.....and usually for 3 days each stay. We usually stay on the concierge floor and find the experience is a 5 star EVERY TIME. I just love this place.
reviews.title: Pure pleasure but Ritz Residences @ Lido Key superb!!!

reviews.text: We enjoy 'staycations' at the Ritz Sarasota several times a year, usually for 2-3 nights at a time. We LOVE this hotel - the staff is top-notch, food is creative and amazing (try the Brunch if you have a chance!), spa is world-class, hotel is beautiful and the Beach Club on Lido Beach is great for lounging near the sand and surf. Management is quick to respond and correct any problem, should you have one. The Club Level is the way to go - great food (serve yourself) 4 times a day, cocktails to order and a fantastic staff, just down the hall from your room. A shuttle is available to take guests to the Beach Club (5 min.) and back. There's a game room on the pool level at the hotel, too. It truly feels like we have left our home and are 'away' on vacation when we stay here.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ritz Carlton Sarasota was incredible from start to finish. The hotel is only about 15 minutes from the Sarasota airport and the valets were incredibly friendly and helpful. My husband and I each had a glass of champagne while checking in and we were happy to find that our room was ready despite it being close to 2 hours before check-in time. The check-in process took less than 5 minutes and we were then shown to our room with our luggage following close behind us. The room was the well appointed and clean, as you would expect with a Ritz-Carlton room.
reviews.title: We Should Have Stayed Longer

likes.disliked: — The cloth shower curtains - water sprays everywhere!

reviews.text: We were eager to get to the beach club and to get some lunch so we decided to take the Ritz’s shuttle bus which departs the hotel hourly. The beach club is only about 10 minutes away and the shuttle takes you through St. Armand’s circle and through a very quiet section of Sarasota before arriving at a miniature version of the hotel on the beach. The beach club is incredible and does not get a lot of feedback in the other reviews but is really worth the trip. The club has lockers for the guests to use, a very nice pool, and a good beach location. The staff at the beach club was always happy to set up lounge chairs, get towels, take drink and food orders, and answer any other requests from the guests. The water at the beach was calm, warm, and fairly clear and the sand (while not the incredible white sand of Siesta Key) was still very nice. We ordered drinks and food to be delivered by both the pool and beach and always got incredible service. We also ate lunch one day at the Tiki Hut which has a slightly different menu and different drink options and was very fun. We found that there were drink specials here, $6-$7 for alcoholic mixed beverages. Michael, our bartender at the Tiki Hut was very nice and advised us of some things to do in town over the 4th of July holiday weekend.
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation

reviews.text: Our entire trip went without incident and was really enjoyable and relaxing. The shuttle service to St. Armand’s circle was very nice and we took advantage of it occasionally, but for the most part, we drove our rental car to the beach club and a variety of other locations in town. Valet service was always good and calling 5 minutes before heading down ensured that your car would be waiting and the valets were always happy to provide restaurant recommendations or directions. The valet service was also very good at the beach club and they would address you by name after receiving word from the guard at the gate that you were on your way up the driveway.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked the reconnect package which included breakfast daily, valet parking, and a $25 per day resort credit which was really a great deal and well worth it. The breakfast which was available at Vernona or through in room dining was always very good.
reviews.title: Amazing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our last night in Sarasota we ate dinner at Vernona and it was by far our best meal of the trip. We had dinner at a number of restaurants in Sarasota during which were all pretty good but they did not come close to our experience at Vernona. The evening started out with the Chef de Cuisine, Greg Howe, coming out to meet each table and each course was extremely good (although the Lemon Sole had a Rice Krispie crust, which was a little startling at first, everything was actually quite good).
reviews.title: Nice - but somewhat tired interior

likes.disliked: — Tired and worn furniture. The hotel needs some money invested in a face lift.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read several negative comments regarding The Ritz Carlton I approached my stay with a little trepidation. However, with the exception of one point, The Ritz exceeded my expectations and I would have no hesitation in recommending it.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Ritz

reviews.text: That one exception was, as mentioned by a previous reviewer, a room on the 2nd floor overlooking a roof. I refused to accept the room and after several minutes negotation, undertaken by the Bell Boy who brought up our luggage, was moved to a 5th floor room. When booking on the hotel's website you can request a room on a high floor, however, there is no guarantee that this request will be granted. Beware. I had previously seen comments about rooms being small. I travel extensively for business, and yes I've had bigger rooms but have certainly had smaller and would not say this was a problem.
reviews.title: Perfect wedding at the Ritz!

likes.liked: — extraordinary service and the beach club is perfect
likes.disliked: — Couldn't afford to stay there for ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All hotel staff we encountered gave excellent, friendly service. The beach club staff in particular kept glasses of water flowing even when they were busy at the weekend. Do try the bar's signature drink, a chocolate Martini. No doubt packed with calories but if you have a sweet tooth absolutely wonderful.
reviews.title: Not great, not bad...just okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do try The Ritz Carlton. It's down town location (this is a US town with a centre you can walk round with good restaurants), coupled with the beach club, gives you the best of both worlds. The complimentary hotel shuttle bus to St Armands Circle and the beach club negates the need to drive. On that subject if you wish to save the valet parking fee you may find parking space on the drive ways leading up to the hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely R-C !!

likes.disliked: — No flat screen TV's ( being changed as we left)

reviews.text: My wife and I were married last November 10, 2007 at the Ritz Carlton beach club in Sarasota, Florida. I read several of the reviews prior to choosing this destination and I was rather nervous. I'd have to say that when things first started off we too had a very bad experience. The Rep that we were given was too young, not married and had little experience. Since we were planning this wedding from California, we didn't have the time for mistakes. The Rep's big mistake happened when my wife flew down there and he didn't show up where he was supposed to and several hours passed by and then he blamed her for the mishap. Bad idea. It was at this time we had had enough and we gave the hotel an ultimatum and they stepped up. The Rep was promptly replaced by the Director of meetings and special events, Mel Van Den Bergh. From that day forward, the entire experience changed. Mel was always in constant contact with us, arranged every last detail, threw in many extras and turned our wedding into the most perfect day possible. Working with Mel was truly first class. I do not think he ever said "No" to us. Everything was possible and I mean everything. We received bottles of wine and champagne, chocolates, flowers, golf shirts and cards signed by all the staff. We didn't know if it was going to rain or freeze us out on our wedding night and when the clouds went away and the evening warmed up, they didn't charge us for the tent or heaters. Mel took care of all the little particulars and he also wasn't afraid to make several recommendations which turned out to really make things special. And it wasn't just Mel. Once we arrived at the hotel everyone knew who we were and went the extra mile to please us. Not only us but all our guests and family! On the day of the wedding Mel assigned two coordinators to help my wife with any last minute details which really took a load off of her and most of the wedding party. Maria one of the coordinators was just outstanding. As for the food, it was insane. Our guests still talk about the appetizers especially the lamb chops! We had a surf and turf sit down dinner that would rival any five star restaurant. Mel and the Ritz Carlton made our wedding the best it could possibly be. There are many other tidbits that I could talk about that were also special but I wouldn't want to take away those moments from anyone else who is lucky enough to have their wedding there. Needless to say, I would recommend the Ritz Carlton to everyone who wants a story book wedding down on the beach. We plan to go back every year to celebrate what a fantastic experience it was and hopefully say hi to Mel and all the staff because they have become family! All the best, Bill & Sue Fisher
reviews.title: Really friendly Understated Luxury

likes.liked: — The wonderful laid back luxury atmosphere

reviews.text: Family trip for some beach time. Spacious suite was very reasonable. Pool at hotel fine, pool at beach club via free shuttle nothing special but right on beach. Beach was best we've been to. Golf at members club lush and well manicured but not very interesting or unique. Travel to golf about 15 min and must request transportation ahead of time.
reviews.title: First time at a Ritz - not disappointed

reviews.text: Upon arrival we weren't greeted by the valet for several meetings until one of the guys finally spun around and said "welcome back", which was odd since we had never stayed there. There was no staff to open the hotel doors on our way to check in nor for the couple of times that day we left and reentered. When making the reservation, the agent noted a request for a room upgrade to a suite and said we would probably be granted the request as the hotel wasn't busy and we've spent 60 nights this year alone at Marriott hotels. This didn't go so smoothly. They had plenty of suites available but the clerk decided he wanted an extra $150 per night and denied the request without additional payment. This normally wouldn't have been an issue but our 12 year old daughter was with us and their small rooms and beds would make for an uncomfortable stay. The first night we had a horrible sleep with two adults in a hotel double (which is really a single) so we decided to call and ask the hotel manager nice again for the room upgrade or pack up and leave on the day of our anniversary and just one day into our three day stay. I spoke with Lorna who was absolutely understanding, apologetic and wonderful in providing the upgrade to a suite at no additional cost to us. Thanks to Lorna my review of this location is much better than it would have been. The next two nights we slept in comfort. We also noticed an increase in overall service and staff calling us by name.
reviews.title: Not so Ritzy place to stay

reviews.text: The night of our anniversary brought another interesting turn of events as we asked the concierge for a commendation on a small privately owned Italian restaurant to dine at. She gave us an address that we found out the next day was two years old. We never located the restaurant that evening and settled on A chain steak house.
reviews.title: Definitely recommend! Great staff, service and property!

reviews.text: Housekeeping was superb and nightly turn down with chocolates a nice touch. I can't forget the homemade cookies delivered to our room on the first evening which was another nice touch.
reviews.title: We love this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this as a vacation type hotel as it doesn't provide that feel.
reviews.title: Service was great, but not a top of the line Ritz

reviews.text: We stayed for four days and from the moment we walked in to the moment we left, there was nothing in particular that would stand out for us. The hotel was average. From their pool you can see the hyatt (which is cheaper and just as good in the inside. I would recommend to stay in another hotel if you want to be by the beach. The rooms overall were ok, except that the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything going on next door!!!! At least in the 9th . I requested a crib, once I saw how outdated it was I decided to not use it and use our playpen instead. The valet is $24- p/n plus tax!!! But you can park anywhere in front of the hotel and is free just make sure you let them know because otherwise they will charge you automatically.
reviews.title: Not worth $300.00 p/n

reviews.text: The service that we received at this hotel was wonderful. We were greeted with a glass of champagne as we were checking in. The room was fairly large with a beautiful outside view. This was our first stay in Sarasota and everyone at the hotel was very helpful. Their beach club was absolutely beautiful. The shuttle to get there was very convenient. It would also drop you off in the shopping district which was very nice. The hotel had nice pools for the children to swim in, along with ping pong tables and a game room. We had a fabulous time and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: We will definitely be back

reviews.text: Really looked forward to staying in this hotel after the positive Tripadvisor reviews.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 8 days and the experience was well below par.
reviews.title: Worst check-in ever, Best Restaurant

reviews.text: Pros - Friendly valet staff
reviews.title: Didn't disappoint

reviews.text: Partner and I stayed here the nights of 6-15-12 and 6-16-12 to meet up with a couple of friends. The hotel and property are nice, service is fine. They could probably use one more bar/lounge but the real problem is the noise. A considerable amount of noise from the hallway can be heard in the room, we could easily hear the people in the next room while we were in our room and it's hard to describe the noise that comes from the toilets. If you use the toilet in the middle of the night and flush it will definitely wake anyone in the room with you. We could even hear the toilets flush in the rooms next to us, both from in our room and when we were in the hallways. Nice pool area, very nice beach club (a short drive from the hotel and they have a shuttle). I've given this hotel an average rating soley due to the noise problems (and also due to stains on the furniture in the room).
reviews.title: Nice hotel with serious noise issues

reviews.text: I recently spent 3 nights at the Ritz Sarasota, Fl on a vacation to see my daughter in Tampa and we decided to get away for some sun and relaxation. Sun was not out all the time due to Tropical Storm Debbie coming in, but we got 2 days of decent weather, but the main reason we stayed here is the quality of this property. It is just lovely from the moment you step through the doors, EVERYONE was so friendly and helpful. The front desk didn't have our room ready so we were able to change in the "spa" and hang out at the pool which was very nice and quiet. When we were able to check into our rooms, we were Not disappointed, they were lovely with a "Bayfront View". Every amenity you would expect of a hotel of this caliber. We dined in the restaurant that night and had one of the best meals of my trip, it was stunning. Breakfast every morning was great as well. My daughter "Who's 26" hung out in the bar after dinner and caught the Basketball finals on TV and just had a ball. It was all very classy. The best part was you had access to the Ritz Carlton Beach Club on Lido Key. We had our own car, but there is a shuttle that departs every hour. It was not too busy and we had a great spot on the beach. The staff was very attentive and set us up with towels and a bucket of ice and water. We had lunch in the club and it was really good. We went all 3 days and although we didn't have sun the last two days, it was still warm and great to just sit and visit and listen and watch the ocean. I highly recommend this property. I only had one complaint and that was the staff uniforms they were just dreadful. I so wanted to re-do all of them. Nothing fit on ANYONE from the main desk to the staff in restaurant. It is not a big deal, but you would expect a hotel like the Ritz to have their staff reflect their environment and this just did NOTHING but scream 2 star hotel. I would hope they would re think the HUGE grey blazers and HUGE pants that was like a ONE SIZE fits all!! I felt so bad for them. I am not a clothes snob, but I know they could do better than this. But trip was great and I can't wait to go back again, as I was in Florida for over a week and those 3 days at the Ritz were the best nights sleep I got. The beds are heavenly, the bathroom was huge and the room itself had a large balcony overlooking the bay and pool. We spent quite a bit of time out there in the evening. This is a perfect place for families, or couples and def. a place for conventions. There were 3 conventions while we were there but you would never know it, it was always quiet and peaceful. Thank You Ritz for providing us with a FUN days!
reviews.title: Great Location and lot's of perks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a 5 day holiday with two couples and felt as though nothing was too much for the staff members throughout the ritz facilities. everyone seemed to love their job from the beach club shuttle driver to the breakfast waiter to the golf concierge. the hotel is not beachfront which is one of its only detractions, but once you arrive at the beach club its mini-resort-within-a-resort feel and full service, it isn't a problem.
reviews.title: 5 star service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: cons: location away from the beach, slightly outdated room/balcony decor (although clean, and large marble bath), not much "adults-only" areas if not travelling with children (including at 11pm on the dancefloor in the lounge)
reviews.title: Awesome one night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: pros: first-rate service by every staff member, great quality food on-site and fair amount of choice, lovely white sand private beach with full-service beach club, free transport to their members golf club, shuttle service to St. Armand's Circle so everyone can drink and eat at dinner without worry, nightly live music in the large bar/lounge, awesome tiki bar on the beach which hasn't been ruined by hotel ownership
reviews.title: Worst Ritz experience
nothing great
reviews.text: The good: The room was nice had a good water view (canal) and was comfortable over all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The disappointing: hotel does not have parking, you are advised to park on the street if one is lucky enough to find a spot otherwise its 25 per day for valet .Wifi is an extra 9+ dollars daily
reviews.title: EXCELLENCE!!!

reviews.text: Cabinets in bathroom are unfinished when the doors are open you see only cement floor see pics. Trim on door missing big piece of wood snags clothes see pics
reviews.title: The Ritz Treatment

reviews.text: Overall okay for business but not for vacation, have to drive to the beach.
reviews.title: 2nd stay equally as fabulous as the first

reviews.text: Spent 2 nights at the Ritz and absolutely LOVED IT!!!!!. The Hotel is beautiful, the service is
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at the Ritz

reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz for a girls weekend to celebrate a friends birthday. The stay, as usual, was great. The staff is very helpful and pleasant. The room was large and very clean; as was the bathroom. The grounds were immaculate at both the hotel and beach club. The beach club is beyond words as to how nice it is.
reviews.title: Another fantastic stay at the Ritz in Sarasota

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz for three nights in July with our teenage son in a suite overlooking the bay. We loved everything about the hotel. Despite the fancy pants look of the place, the staff was completely down to earth and never uppity; in fact everyone was incredibly helpful, and little touches like offering us bottles of cold water were great.
reviews.title: We loved the Ritz

likes.liked: — Exceptionally comfortable hotel and beach club
likes.disliked: — Price (but it was worth every cent)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was comfortable and immaculate. The beach club is amazingly nice. The food is good and location is wonderful. We took the Segway tour offered by a local in-town group; highly recommend it as a fun way to learn about Sarasota while cruising on a very cool little transporter.
reviews.title: Our New Favorite Place to Stay

reviews.text: When the piggy bank allows, we would definitely return to the Sarasota Ritz Carlton.
reviews.title: great service

likes.disliked: — Cell phone use in the club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We could not have been more pleased with our experience (five days) at the Ritz-Carlton in Sarasota. Our room, overlooking Sarasota Bay was quite generous in size; the bathroom was lovely, always spotless and well-stocked. The staff, from beginning to end was pleasant & accomodating, and never stuffy. The Beach Club was gorgeous - you could not ask for a better setting. There is a beautiful locker room for dressing and showering - certainly no need to change in the rest room as reported by a previous reviewer. The valets at both the hotel and the beach were great. We never left, nor arrived back without being greetly warmly and offered a bottle of cold water. There are several great walks to take from the hotel: a five miler to St. Armand's Circle & back; the Sarasota Bayfront Park & Marina to look at the yachts & sailboats, and another to downtown. My husband used the spa and reported the experience was "fantastic." We had several meals Gulf and poolside, and were not disappointed. All in all, we would return to the Ritz-Carlton in Sarasota anytime; believe it or not, we found it to be a good value for the class of resort, ammenities, location and service.
reviews.title: Hotel was nice, but Beach Club made our trip great

likes.disliked: — The shuttle to/from the beach club.

reviews.text: We recently spent three days at the Ritz Carlton Sarasota and I was terribly disappointed with the condition of my room. First of all, the bed could have been used as a torture device. As you may be able to tell from the photo I have posted, the mattress was completely worn out and even sloped downward on the top left corner. I had difficulty sleeping and both my husband and I were very sore in the morning. There were actual STAINS on the furniture that were so suspicious that I put a towel on the chair before I would sit on it. Overall the furniture was shabby and worn out. I took pictures of the bathmat that was in our beautiful and VERY EXPENSIVE bathroom. I don't think it would have taken much effort to trim the ragged edges before putting it into our room.
reviews.title: Ritz ain't so ritzy in Sarasota

reviews.text: Since we were spending so much money on the room, I decided to contact management. I requested that a member of the management staff come up to the room and see for themselves so that they didn't think I was making things up to complain about. A very nice, accommodating manager arrived promptly at my door and he agreed that the condition of the room was unacceptable. That evening everything that was dirty or worn out was removed from the room and replaced (even the mattress!!!) We then proceeded to have two restful nights in a decent, but still not great, mattress.
reviews.title: Had a great time!

likes.disliked: — The ride to the beach club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beach Club is absolutely beautiful and the beach is lovely. They have a drumming ceremony when the sun sets that is fun and different. The location of the hotel itself is nothing special. As noted by others, the Beach Club is a short ride from the hotel (free shuttle provided). There is really nothing nice to look at on the outside of the hotel - it is in a city area with a limited view of the water.
reviews.title: Fablous hotel except for the restaurant
A true 5 star property
reviews.text: I was very disappointed that nothing more was made of our bad experience by Ritz Carlton management. I felt as if I had to do their job for them and pay for the privilege. I am going to write a detailed letter to them and I will post whether I got a pleasant response. I thought there should have been at least some free drinks or flowers sent to the room as an apology for the less than adequate furniture.

reviews.title: Thumbs Up
reviews.text: The Armand Circle area is an interesting shopping/eating area that the free shuttle will drop you at. About 15 minutes from the hotel is Siesta Key which is more laid back and they also have great places to eat and drink. The beach on Siesta Key is stunning and really worth going to see - the sand is pure white. They also have food service there - you can get a cheap, freshly made breakfast after you walk the beach in the morning!!

Our family has stayed at this property 6 to 7 times over the past few years. It has always been a great place to enjoy time with family and a great location to enjoy the Sarasota area. The rooms, although smaller in size, are always comfortable. The beach servers, ecspeicaly Amy, are quick to recognize a repeat guest. We have stayed at the hotel during the "Florida Dance Sport" competition before and never noticed any change in the level of service to guests. I am disappointed to report that this year the event seemed to overwhelm the capacities of the resort. The CLUB LEVEL area was complete chaos with neither the staff or the space to accommodate registered guests. (200% oversold according to one concierge) There was a significant security issue with one particular patron of the lounge disrobing and assaulting a server. It took a very long time for security to arrive. It was a very upsetting display for all present. It was the talk of the hotel for a few days. I assumed that the hotel would acknowledge this terrible incident in some way. They failed in this regard.
reviews.title: Did not meet expectations

reviews.text: We had very inconsistent service in the lounge area. We asked for a late night cup of coffee (9:30) from the bartender who replied "can't do it - I just poured it out". On another evening, we wanted to enjoy some entertainment in the lounge. There were four unoccupied seats (with what appeared to be almost empty cocktails) at the bar for over an hour. My husband asked on several occassions if we might be seated. As it turns out, these seats were being "saved" for local residents who had previously requested them. In short, in this way and others the hotel was not at its best for the week that we were guests. I think we will reconsider our next visit. I hope for the hotel that they pay attention to the reviews over this particular time period.
reviews.title: Above and Beyond

reviews.text: I know that luxury hotels are supposed to be over the top in terms of service. This one far surpasses any I've experienced (and I have stayed in dozens). I pulled up into the valet area after a particularly long, hard trip caring for an ill family member. I had a day and a half to myself before I returned home. The valet asked if I were checking in and I said, "Yes, if there's an empty room."
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful -- suite was spotless & staff was welcoming

reviews.text: He opened the car door for me, took me by the arm and walked me in to the front desk. The front desk agent took over from there. I must have looked like I was really in need, because every staff member seemed to sense that I had been through the mill. Before I knew it, I had a magnificent room at a very affordable price ($250). I expected to pay much more as a walk in.
reviews.title: First time in Sarasota

reviews.text: The desk agent sent up complimentary hot tea and cookies within minutes. It seemed everyone I encountered (and I wish I had gotten their names to thank them personally) knew just what i needed, the moment i needed it.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.text: Service was exceptional even for the Ritz which you would expect to be outstanding. The complementary champagne and strawberrys for my girlfriend's birthday was a nice touch. Walk to marinas and the old town district. Short drive to a magnificent beach front club, private and exclusive. For a romantic weekend getaway highly recommended.
reviews.title: Expect to be pampared
Overpriced and overrated
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz for the weekend to celebrate our anniversary. While the first impression as you drive up is very good, that soon ended when we arrived at the front door and waited in our car for 5 minutes because the valets were behind. Several staff members were walking around but none helped us. When someone came to open my door, they took the keys from my husband and left our 3 year-old in the car! I got my son out and we proceeded to the lobby where we were greeted by no one! I waited in the lobby another 5 minutes for my husband to come in from outside. The check-in process took another 5 - 10 minutes and by the time we got to our room, I was steaming! Customer Service = 0!!! The room was on the second floor and overlooked a ROOF! When our luggage arrived, my husband told the porter we would not be staying in this room. He did call the front desk (he was on hold for yet another 5 minutes) and got us a room with a better view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the room itself, it was only average. It's what I would expect from a 4 star hotel. Definitely not 5 star. Everything was clean and maintained but the decor seemed "aged". I also thought the rooms were small.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We ate at Flemings steakhouse which was incredible! I'd highly recommend the service, food and atmosphere. When we arrived back to the hotel, the maid had turned down our bed and left chocolates on our pillows (although only two despite there were three of us). I did think that was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Shabby chic?? No just downright shabby!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night at the beginning of June and I am pleased to say that this hotel maintains the high standard you would expect from the Ritz. Porters are fab, very informative. We did not eat in the hotel so can not comment on the food. The only negative of this hotel is that it is not near the beach, although in fairness the hotel can not do a lot about this!! They do supply a courtesy bus to take you to their beach resort which is, in all honesty the best they can do. A good all round hotel.
reviews.title: A Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful and immaculate, and the suites are lovely, with a separate lavatory, and a luxurious bathroom. The food at all of the restaurants, and in room service, is excellent. The staff goes out of their way to be helpful and friendly. The only drawback is that you can hear noise from the hallways while in the living room of the suite.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in Sarasota

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a Ritz- elegant, top end and runs like clockwork. Staff, as always, was friendly and efficient. The hotel is new looking and beautifully situated downtown on one of the waterways- the pool and covered bar terrace overlook a marina. We rolled in off the 75 at 1:30pm right as a terrific thunderstorm started up and were very happy to see the hotel through the driving rain. We checked in quickly and discovered that we could get a late lunch in the bar. My wife and I soon found ourselves sitting outside but under the roof of the terrace, warm and dry, watching the incredible weather howling past a few feet away as we enjoyed drinks and some excellent seafood. The Ahi Salad and a generous plate of fried Calamari didn't last as long as the downpour did. Now that's what I call shelter from the storm.
reviews.title: Another Great Ritz Experience

reviews.text: Went as part of a business trip with extra weekend time. Large hotel, big bedrooms and bathrooms, good facilities. Breakfast OK but not its real selling point. The Beach Club is amazing - wonderful views great pools and loungers and access to a gorgeous white sand beach.
reviews.title: Good international hotel with all the facilities
World Class
reviews.text: Exceeded our expectations in every way and provided exceptionally good value. Will make it our home from home in Sarasota for our annual visit.

Our weekend stay for a family wedding on June 15-17, 2012 was wonderful. The service was outstanding in every respect. Champagne was served as we waited just a few minutes to check in! Hans who escorted us to our room was very thorough in explaining the hotel's amenities to ensure we enjoyed our stay. The service at the Beach Club was stellar-- we only had a short time to relax, get a drink, and a bite to eat and they really hustled to meet our time constraints. The spa, pool, and fitness center were fabulous and the arrangements for the wedding on the beach, reception on the grassy terrace, and dinner on the covered terrace were outstanding and so beautifully done. The staff called us by name and gladly prepared dishes that were not on the menu. An awesome experience and we are definitely returning for our own vacation! All shuttle bus drivers, valet personnel, and doormen were very well groomed, polite, and extremely friendly. We feel the service was the best we have ever experienced and we have traveled to over 30 countries. It was "over the top".
reviews.title: Over the Top Service at the Ritz in Sarasota

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment you arrive to the time you leave you feel as rich as your surroundings! Pampered by all staff that you encounter. The Beach Club was superb. Laid under an umbrella with my hubby at their beach. Ordered their famous mai-tai and snack food and spent a wonderful day. Later on that evening went back for a delicious dinner. Than back to the hotel for drinks and dancing. Repeated the same the next day. Sarasota has a lovely main street with shops and restaurants. There of course is St. Armands Circle which the Ritz will also take you to on their free shuttle.
reviews.title: The Best Time for a Great Weekend Away!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: The only things to remember people love to dress up for their dancing with their live music which is quite good.
reviews.title: A retirement home disguised as a Ritz-Carlton

reviews.text: Upon check in ask for extra towels and extra regular coffee if you use a regular amount as I thought what was there would be enough. But all the swimming and beach time amounts to extra bathing and the coffee is needed to keep you going with more activities than you would normally have!!! Have a great time here!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Not up to my idea of a Ritz Carlton

reviews.text: I recently visited this Ritz-Carlton on Memorial Day for lunch. Since I have stayed at other Ritz properties, and always have an exceptional experience, I wanted to check this one out since I live less than an hour away.
reviews.title: Disappointed in a world class hotel
